title: Join does not work on borrowed Strings

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
I tried this code: ```rust let errors = vec![&String::from("hi"), &String::from("world")]; let combined = errors.join(" "); ``` (This is a contrived example, of course, what I was really doing was borrowing from inside a parsed data structure, which led to the &Strings). I expected to see this happen: the strings to join together, just as if they were &str or String Instead, this happened: I received the following error ``` error[E0599]: the method `join` exists for struct `Vec<&std::string::String>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied --> src/main.rs:103:35 | 103 | let combined = errors.join(" ; "); | ^^^^ method cannot be called on `Vec<&std::string::String>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds | = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied: `<[&std::string::String] as Join<_>>::Output = _` ``` (Which took me a good while to work out what I needed to do even looking at the source code for Join and such, as this was extremely opaque to someone fairly new to Rust). ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.0-nightly (35dbef235 2021-03-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 35dbef235048f9a2939dc20effe083ca483c37ff commit-date: 2021-03-02 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.52.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ```
Backtrace

``` error[E0599]: the method `join` exists for struct `Vec<&std::string::String>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied --> src/main.rs:103:35 | 103 | let combined = errors.join(" ; "); | ^^^^ method cannot be called on `Vec<&std::string::String>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds | = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied: `<[&std::string::String] as Join<_>>::Output = _` ```
